q: How do motorized flood barriers operate?
a: Electric or hydraulic actuators raise barriers from recessed pits within 20 seconds. Integrated limit switches ensure full lock before flood onset.

q: What happens during a power outage?
a: Units include battery backup (48 V DC) good for two full cycles. Manual override crank supplied for redundancy.

q: Are motorized systems reliable in salt environments?
a: Yes—IP68 motors and 316 SS shafts resist corrosion. Annual lubrication per maintenance schedule required.

q: Can I connect barriers to smart-building systems?
a: Yes—Modbus RTU / BACnet integration enables remote monitoring, automatic alerts, and tie-in with storm sensors.

q: What permits are needed for motorized barriers?
a: Mechanical permit and electrical tie-in inspection. Drawings stamped by PE per Florida Building Code Sec 1612. See Miami installations.

q: What is the lifespan of motors and actuators?
a: Rated 10,000 cycles (~20 years typical). Electronics potted against moisture for extended reliability.
